title: Citibank Clients Are the First to Use Contactless Credit Cards Issued in the Czech Republic
summary: Prague – Citibank has launched the first contactless Shell MasterCard credit card that allows its holders to make contactless payments at all Shell stations and other retailers equipped with contactless technology. The first successful contactless transactions were made in Žilina in Slovakia and in Jelenia Gora and Wodzislaw Slaski in Poland, where the contactless technology is already widespread and commonly used. Citibank clients, as holders of the first contactless credit cards issued in the Czech Republic, are first to benefit from the contactless technology when making their payments.
tag-1: Citibank Clients Are the First to Use Contactless Credit Cards Issued in the Czech Republic
tag-2: Prague – Citibank has launched the first contactless Shell MasterCard credit card that allows its holders to make contactless payments at all Shell stations and other retailers equipped with contactless technology. The first successful contactless transactions were made in Žilina in Slovakia and in Jelenia Gora and Wodzislaw Slaski in Poland, where the contactless technology is already widespread and commonly used. Citibank clients, as holders of the first contactless credit cards issued in the Czech Republic, are first to benefit from the contactless technology when making their payments.
tag-3: The Shell MasterCard contactless credit card from Citibank is issued in cooperation with MasterCard, whose contactless payments technology is certified under the MasterdCard PayPass name. "I'm very pleased that Citibank has yet again shown leadership in innovations and offered its clients, as the first ones in the Czech Republic, the possibility to use contactless payments," said George Denisenko, Consumer Lending Head at Citibank in the Czech Republic.
tag-4: "The PayPass technology allows customers to pay for small purchases more quickly and conveniently than with cash. The technology has been used successfully in a number of countries. It has been on the rise in most European countries over the last several years and will be available for clients within the Czech Republic this fall," added Denisenko.
tag-5: Contactless payment is useful everywhere transaction speed is important – at stadiums, in fast-food restaurants, coffee shops and at petrol stations. Aside from cutting transaction time compared to a regular card payment, users will enjoy not having to carry a lot of change. Payments of up to 20 EUR (the maximum amount ranges from 20 – 25 EUR depending on the country) do not require a PIN code authorization or signature by the card holder. Even so, transaction security is maintained, as the client has the payment card under control at all times. Moreover, payments above 20 EUR do require a PIN code authorization to ensure the appropriate level of security for clients.
